Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Merge branch 'dev' into master" (#7864) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Deployment item: https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/3051

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Merge branch 'dev' into master" (#7864) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "On nuget.org the versions of Microsoft.ChakraCore are incorrect when read from the APIs" (#7863) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
On nuget.org, the versions reported by the API differs from the versions reported by the web interface for Microsoft.ChakraCore

### To Reproduce
Using a browser, visit https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.ChakraCore/
You can see the latest version is 1.11.16 (confirmed)

Using curl, access the information about the library:
https://api.nuget.org/v3/registration3/microsoft.chakracore/index.json
You can see the latest version is 1.11.15

### Expected behavior
The versions reported from the web interface and the versions reported from the API are consistent.

### Screenshots
**WEB:**  
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/186370/76203510-ac5b5980-61ee-11ea-8f31-46a98e23c270.png)

**API:**  
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/186370/76203565-c72dce00-61ee-11ea-966a-571b9fc6272e.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Expose domain and diagnostics source in MEF container" (#7862) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
This enables synchronous initialization (via the constructor) of the cookie compliance shim.
Also, move the refresh to the background so that initial start-up is not slowed down.

Fully lights up with https://nuget.visualstudio.com/NuGetMicrosoft/_git/NuGet.Shims/pullrequest/1342.
Related to https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/2980.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Reject broken ZIPs on API push with better message" (#7859) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Address https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/3046

This was a little tricky to repro locally, when reading a ZIP of disk because the behavior of `FileStream` and `HttpInputStream` (the stream from an ASP.NET file upload) is different. `FileStream` does not throw when you seek out of bounds. It only throws when you read. `HttpInputStream` throws when you seek out of bounds, thus the `ArgumentOutOfRangeException` we see on server side.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Download count isn't updated when self-hosting in IIS" (#7861) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: I have configured a instance of NuGet Gallery running under IIS using SQL Server as the database.  The download count doesn't appear to updating regardless of whether the download is via NuGet Install-Package or through the package download link on the website.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Test Failure] Embedded icon of the package creating by nuget.exe can’t be shown in PM UI with local package feed" (#9225) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version: NuGet Client Dev\5.6.0.6472
VS Version: Master\29825.171
OS: Windows-10-Enterprise-RS5
## Detailed repro steps
1.	Create a Class Library (.NET Framework 4.8) in VS and build the solution.
2.	In the Developer Command Prompt for VS, create a nuspec file by executing command “nuget spec”
3.  Make an image file (size limited to 1 MB with JPEG/PNG format and 128x128 resolution) and locate in the package.
4.  Add following to nuspec file.
```
<package>
  <metadata>
    ...
    <icon>images\icon.png</icon>
    ...
  </metadata>
  <files>
    ...
    <file src="..\icon.png" target="images\" />
    ...
  </files>
</package>
```
5.  Pack the package to local path by executing command “nuget pack”.
6.  Create a C# Console App (.NET Framework 4.8) in VS and open the PM UI of the project.
7.  Add the package source as a local feed in Settings->NuGet Package Manager->Package Sources.
8.  Select the new added local feed in the Package source dropdown box in the PM UI and install the package.

## Expected
The embedded icon show correctly in all the tabs of PM UI.
## Actual
The embedded icon can’t be shown in all the tabs of PM UI. as below screenshot.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/75345053-e8c9b400-58d6-11ea-8a4b-0c9f2a076604.png)
## Note
1.	It doesn’t repro for the package creating by “dotnet pack” with local package feed.
2.	It doesn’t repro for the package “Text2Xml.Lib” (version 1.1.1 and 1.1.2) in remote feed.
3.	It also repro with icon.jpg.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Ensure Static Graph restore is available in dotnet.exe" (#9267) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
This basically means ingesting https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Build.Tasks.Console/NuGet.Build.Tasks.Console.csproj into the SDK. 

We should discuss with the .NET Core team what branches they want the changes in. 

fyi @jeffkl

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Clarify TargetFramework vs TargetFrameworks vs TargetFrameworkMoniker across the NuGet codebase." (#8388) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "Remove temporary WorkaroundNetStandard target from common.targets" (#8364) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Related issue: https://github.com/dotnet/cli/issues/11378
The above issue is already fixed in VS 2019 16.2 preview2. 
But we don't have the latest version of VS on VSEng-MicroBuildVS2019 agent pool (the current version is 16.1.6). So we have to add a temporary WorkaroundNetStandard target to common.targets to make the build pass.

We need to remove this WorkaroundNetStandard target from common.targets when the VS on agent pool VSEng-MicroBuildVS2019 has that fix.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Test: E2E test UpdatePackageMissingPackage is flaky" (#9283) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The test has failed numerous times in the last week or two with the following stack trace:

>System.UnauthorizedAccessException: Access to the path 'E:\A\_work\1\s\artifacts\EndToEnd\bin\2310\Solution_e053\packages\NLog.1.0.0.505\lib' is denied.
   at System.IO.__Error.WinIOError(Int32 errorCode, String maybeFullPath)
   at System.IO.FileSystemEnumerableIterator`1.CommonInit()
   at System.IO.FileSystemEnumerableIterator`1..ctor(String path, String originalUserPath, String searchPattern, SearchOption searchOption, SearchResultHandler`1 resultHandler, Boolean checkHost)
   at System.IO.DirectoryInfo.EnumerateDirectories()
   at Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.FileSystemProvider.Dir(DirectoryInfo directory, Boolean recurse, UInt32 depth, Boolean nameOnly, ReturnContainers returnContainers)

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "[Test Failure][Unstable] An error occurred while applying transformation to 'Web.config' when updating packages in ASP.NET Web Forms Site project" (#8929) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version: NuGet Client Dev\5.5.0.6346
VS Version: Master\29612.110
OS: Windows-10-Enterprise-RS5
## Detailed repro steps 
1. Launch VS and click 'Create a New Project' button.
2. Create an ASP.NET Web Forms Site project.
3. Open PM UI of this project and go to ‘Update’ tab.
4. Select all packages and click ‘Update’ button.
## Expected
It is successful to update all the packages.
## Actual
An error occurred while applying transformation to 'Web.config' when updating packages as below screenshot.
![AnErrorOccurred](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/70800124-686ed900-1de6-11ea-875a-94e2da1cef28.PNG)
## Error Message
An error occurred while applying transformation to 'Web.config' in project 'WebSiteForms' The process cannot access the file 'C:\Users\v-luzh\source\repos\WebSite6\WebSite6\Web.config' because it is being used by another process.
The process cannot access the file 'C:\Users\v-luzh\source\repos\WebSite6\WebSite6\Web.config' because it is being used by another process.				
## Note
1. Unstable issue, the repro rate is 50%.
2. It didn’t repro on 16.5 Preview1: D16.5\29521.150 (with implicit NuGet Client 5.5.0.6293).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "RestoreTaskEx swallows errors" (#9282) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
When calling restore on a project with a recent SDK that contains the `RestoreTaskEx` but is missing the `NuGet.Build.Tasks.Console` executable, no failure is logged and no error is thrown.

```
C:\git\runtime4\tools-local\tasks\installer.tasks>dotnet restore /p:RestoreUseStaticGraphEvaluation=true

Microsoft (R) Build Engine version 16.6.0-preview-20105-01+5d872c945 for .NET Core
Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.


C:\git\runtime4\tools-local\tasks\installer.tasks>
```

cc @nkolev92 @jeffkl

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet official builds aren't publishing to a BAR channel anymore" (#9279) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The last successful build that updated the `.NET Core 5 Dev` channel was https://dev.azure.com/devdiv/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=3506459. Since then nuget bits aren't flowing anymore to dotnet/sdk or any subscriber.

```
C:\git\runtime>darc get-build --id 45163
Repository:    https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client
Branch:        dev
Commit:        d39e857e6b1265d1b4990cbe660e2a0ad259e0cf
Build Number:  5.6.0.6492
Date Produced: 3/7/2020 7:32 AM
Build Link:    https://dev.azure.com/devdiv/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=3533068
BAR Build Id:  45163
Channels:

C:\git\runtime>darc get-build --id 44314
Repository:    https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client
Branch:        dev
Commit:        64f2febf7d1de8b0228eca5afed97a96c5a30bba
Build Number:  5.6.0.6478
Date Produced: 2/27/2020 2:21 AM
Build Link:    https://dev.azure.com/devdiv/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=3506459
BAR Build Id:  44314
Channels:
- .NET Core 5 Dev
```

cc @mmitche @nkolev92 @JohnTortugo

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue ""dotnet nuget push -s c:/localdir" creates flat directory structure" (#9281) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

dotnet.exe --version:
3.1.101

OS version:

win10 1803

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

```
$ dotnet nuget push -s C:\localdir myapp.1.3.0.nupkg
```

Observe that c:/localdir now contains myapp.1.3.0.nupkg at top level instead of the "new" hierarchical nuget directory structure.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Deprecating TLS 1.0 and 1.1 on NuGet.org – Stage 1" (#42) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
## NuGet.org will temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 on February 26, 2020

We plan to temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 across 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each, to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. If you discover that you are impacted and cannot identify a workaround, please open an issue on the NuGet Gallery GitHub repo.

Read this blog post to learn more and to identify the test slot time in your time zone - https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/deprecating-tls-1-0-and-1-1-on-nuget-org-stage-1/
